intro: Dichocarpum auriculatum var. puberulum, commonly known as the pubescent bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its hairy, pubescent stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
